contentrichtext.text: [[File:Stephen Moore, Vanity Fair, 1883-09-08.jpg|thumb|Caricature of the 3rd Earl Mount Cashell by [[Leslie Ward|Spy]] published in [[Vanity Fair (British magazine 1868-1914)|Vanity Fair]] in 1883.]] '''Earl Mount Cashell''', of [[Cashel, County Tipperary|Cashell]] in the [[County Tipperary|County of Tipperary]], was a title in the [[Peerage of Ireland]]. It was created in 1781 for [[Stephen Moore, 1st Earl Mount Cashell|Stephen Moore, 2nd Viscount Mount Cashell]], who had previously represented [[Lismore (Parliament of Ireland constituency)|Lismore]] in the [[Irish House of Commons]]. He was the eldest surviving son of [[Stephen Moore, 1st Viscount Mount Cashell|Stephen Moore]], member of the Irish Parliament for [[County Tipperary (Parliament of Ireland constituency)|County Tipperary]], who had been created '''Baron Kilworth''', of Moore Park in the [[County Cork|County of Cork]], in 1764 and '''Viscount Mount Cashell''', of the [[Cashel, County Tipperary|City of Cashell]], in 1766. These titles were also in the Peerage of Ireland. The first Earl was succeeded by his eldest son, the second Earl. He sat in the [[House of Lords]] as an elected [[Representative peer|Irish Representative Peer]] from 1815 to 1822. His eldest son, the third Earl, was an Irish Representative Peer from 1826 to 1883. He was succeeded by his elder son, the fourth Earl, who in his turn was succeeded by his younger brother, the fifth Earl. The titles became extinct on the death of the sixth Earl in 1915. [[Richard Moore (1725–1761)|Richard Moore]], eldest son of the first Viscount, represented [[Clonmel (Parliament of Ireland constituency)|Clonmel]] in the Irish Parliament. The Honourable [[William Moore (died 1810)|William Moore]], younger son of the first Viscount, represented [[Clogher (Parliament of Ireland constituency)|Clogher]], Clonmel and [[St Johnstown (Parliament of Ireland constituency)|St Johnstown]] in the Irish Parliament. The family seats were Moore Park, [[County Cork]], Galgorme Castle, [[County Antrim]], and Mount Cashel Lodge, [[County Dublin]]. ==Viscounts Mount Cashell (1766)== *[[Stephen Moore, 1st Viscount Mount Cashell]] (1695–1766) **[[Richard Moore (1725–1761)|Richard Moore]] (1725–1761) *[[Stephen Moore, 1st Earl Mount Cashell|Stephen Moore, 2nd Viscount Mount Cashell]] (1730–1790) (created '''Earl Mount Cashell''' in 1781) ==Earls Mount Cashell (1781)== *[[Stephen Moore, 1st Earl Mount Cashell]] (1730–1790) *[[Stephen Moore, 2nd Earl Mount Cashell]] (1770–1822) *[[Stephen Moore, 3rd Earl Mount Cashell]] (1792–1883) *Stephen Moore, 4th Earl Mount Cashell (1825–1889) *Charles William Moore, 5th Earl Mount Cashell (1826–1898) *Edward George Augustus Harcourt Moore, 6th Earl Mount Cashell (1829–1915) ==See also== *[[Viscount Mount Cashell]] ==References== *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mount Cashell}} [[Category:Earldoms in the Peerage of Ireland]] [[Category:Extinct earldoms in the Peerage of Ireland]]
